description: Bone age dataset: 14K+ pediatric hand/wrist X-rays labeled with bone age (months) & sex. Train/val/test splits for ML training. Preprocess: resize/normalize. Automates skeletal maturity prediction, aiding pediatric growth/disorder diagnosis vs. manual methods.

Bone age dataset: 14K+ pediatric hand/wrist X-rays labeled with bone age (months) & sex. Train/val/test splits for ML training. Preprocess: resize/normalize. Automates skeletal maturity prediction, aiding pediatric growth/disorder diagnosis vs. manual methods.

The dataset was curated by the team for the hackathon using ophthalmic eye images obtained from Vittala Institute of Ophthalmology. Images underwent standardization, quality control, and expert guided labelling into cataract categories.

This dataset was curated by the team for the hackathon using ophthalmic eye images obtained from Vittala Institute of Ophthalmology. Images underwent standardization, quality control, expert-guided labeling into Diabetic Retinopathy for robust machine learning training and evaluation.

At RSNA 2017 there was a contest to correctly identify the age of a child from an X-ray of their hand. This is the dataset on Kaggle making it easier to experiment with and do educational demos. Additionally maybe there are some new ideas for building smarter models for handling X-ray images.
Cataract and normal eye image dataset for cataract detection.

The dataset is divided into three parts: Segmentation: It consists of Original color fundus images (81 images divided into train and test set - JPG Files); Groundtruth images for the Lesions (Microaneurysms, Haemorrhages, Hard Exudates and Soft Exudates divided into train and test set - TIF Files) and Optic Disc (divided into train and test set - TIF Files)
